intro: Gynoxys simulans, commonly known as the false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Gynoxys simulans thrives in humid environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
